ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with hypothalamic hamartoma, postaxial polydactyly, anal atresia, and intellectual disability. The Y-shaped metacarpals/metatarsals are pathognomonic features of this syndrome.
Can present with postaxial polydactyly and intellectual disability, but lacks the characteristic hypothalamic hamartoma and anal malformations seen in this patient.
Features growth delay, intellectual disability, and can have postaxial polydactyly, but Y-shaped metacarpals/metatarsals and hypothalamic hamartoma are not typical.
Can present with postaxial polydactyly and intellectual disability, but lacks the specific skeletal abnormalities (Y-shaped bones) and hypothalamic hamartoma.
Features postaxial polydactyly and can have anal anomalies, but typically lacks intellectual disability and the specific skeletal findings present in this case.
